alert.note: Alert for Greensville; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 8:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Greensville, southwestern Southampton and southwestern Sussex Counties and the City of Emporia through 900 PM EDT... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jarratt, or 12 miles east of Purdy, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could result in ponding of water on roadways in low lying and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Emporia, Sussex, Jarratt, Stony Creek, Claresville, Green Plain, Capron, Adams Grove, Grizzard, Lanes Corner, Booker, Yale, Lumberton, Emporia Reservoir, Worrell, Hilda, Drewryville, Gray, Huske and Owens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
